raytracer.primitives
Class Vector3d

java.lang.Object
  raytracer.primitives.Vector3d

public class Vector3d
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a 3-dimensional vector of doubles.

Author:
(c) 2009-11 Hans-Georg Menz and Roland Fraedrich

Constructor Detail

Vector3d

public Vector3d()
Default Constructor initializing the vector as (0,0,0).

Vector3d

public Vector3d(double[] doubleArray3d)
Contstructor that initializes the vector according to the given 3d-Array. If doubleArray3d is not of length 3, the vector is set to (0, 0, 0).

Parameters:
doubleArray3d - Double-Array of length 3 expected, which is used to set x, y and z.

Vector3d

public Vector3d(double x,
                double y,
                double z)
Constructor that initializes the vector with the given components.

Parameters:
x - X component of the vector.
y - Y component of the vector.
z - Z component of the vector.

crossproduct

public Vector3d crossproduct(Vector3d v)
Calculates the cross product of this vector and v and returns the result as a new vector. This and v remain unchanged.

Parameters:
v - Second operand of the cross product.
Returns:
Result of the cross product as a new vector.

getLength

public double getLength()
Returns the length of the vector.

Returns:
Length of the vector.

plus

public Vector3d plus(Vector3d v)
Componentwise addition of this and v. This and v remain unchanged.

Parameters:
v - Second operand of the addition.
Returns:
Result of the addition as a new vector.

minus

public Vector3d minus(Vector3d v)
Componentwise subtraction of v from this. This and v remain unchanged.

Parameters:
v - Second operand of the subtraction.
Returns:
Result of the subtraction as a new vector.

times

public Vector3d times(double d)
Returns a new scaled vector. The vector itself remains unchanged.

Parameters:
d - Scale factor.
Returns:
New vector with the direction of this, but scaled with d.

getNormalized

public Vector3d getNormalized()
Returns a new normalized version of the vector. The vector itself remains unchanged.

Returns:
New vector with the same direction as this, but with length 1.

normalize

public void normalize()
Normalizes this vector to the length of 1.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the values of a vector like "(1,0,0)"

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

equals

public boolean equals(Vector3d v)
Checks whether this and v have the same x, y and z.

Parameters:
v - Vector to compare this with.
Returns:
True if the vectors are equal, false if not.
